Thought our lunch may be looking better, but no. Remaining service pretty slow (even with what they called the "team approach"), portions small for the price, food bland, barbecue sauces average at best, cornmeal crusted catfish and shrimp very heavy. Not impressed at all. There are many other barbecue choices in the Valley with excellent food, service and prices so we won't be wasting our time at Lucille's again.

NxrCd0I0W3XVIcX-PFUMnQ.text: How depressing!  We used to frequent the Lucille's in green valley Nv.  I think it was one of the first and it was good good good.  So good we would do our business entertaining there.  When we moved home to Az we were very excited to find that they were putting one in Tempe.  Our first visit was good, but for some reason not as good as Vegas, but they were new and we figured they needed a chance to get started.  Second visit, still not so good, third visit, decided not to go back.  That was awhile ago.  Today, my daughter wanted to have lunch there and she only remembers the Nv Lucille's as she has been in Wa.  for a few years.  So we went.   Here's how it went...... She had a Cobb salad and ordered with no eggs, came covered in eggs, sent it back.  Came back with raw chicken......worried me cause although she took it off her salad, it had still touched the rest of her salad and she is breast feeding.  Her husbands fried chicken was so bad that he wouldn't eat it and that boy eats like crazy.  My son had the tri tip that was melt in your mouth in Vegas, but not here.  It was tough and fatty.  I had the sea food platter.  It was something I had never seen. It looked like it was coated with corn meal plastic.  Burnt corn meal plastic.  I peeled it off and there was a teeny tiny piece of cat fish in there.  The grilled artichoke was ok but the dip was wall paste, the fried okra was good, but hey, it's not fresh, it's frozen.  The sweet tea was wonderful and our waiter was nice.  Bottom line......go to Green Valley, next to Vegas.........skip Tempe.  It cost 92 dollars to eat lunch at Lucille's and I use the term " eat" loosely.  I feel like I was robbed!  Not one of us was happy.    I have a lot of good memories at Lucille's years ago, but that was then,  and  this is now.......and now they suck!!!

IkUpQE2E8L_GAnU8MnHWuA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! We visited here 3 times last month! Delicious!  Good food! Good service! Good atmosphere! Great entertainment! Friendly staff! Family friendly!  My kids love the baby back ribs and burgers. Hubby loves the chicken and fried pickles. I love the smoked brisket salad and fried green tomatoes! Their sides are yummy too!  Don't sleep on the dessert! The red velvet cake is on point!  On one visit, we were offered 3 free desserts to take home. THREE! Why? Because our food came out late. Really? We hardly noticed! We didn't complain nor ask. What a way to be proactive with customer service! That alone will have us coming back again and again!  Their live entertainment is slammin' on Saturday nights! Especially if you like New Orleans/southern-style blues and jazz.  Visit Lucille's and have a fun time (and leave full as a tick!)!

gNqb3DUDZGXYRGXSafS6fw.text: Every time I go in this place it's always a great experience.  My wife and I have been going to Lucille's pretty much every other Sunday for the last couple months.  Her favorite is the pulled pork mine is the Kansas City ribs, but we always have to start our meal off with the fried pickles.  If you're on a tight budget even buying one meal and sharing it is a definite option.  Sometimes I get full on the biscuits and spread the provide in the beginning.  The bar area is a great place to have a meal and watch a game.  I would highly recommend this establishment to any of my friends.  But make sure you get the fried pickles... you will not be disappointed.  Oh yeah.....please please please order the Mac 'N Cheese as your side.  You will thank me later.  Q

g5C_3MoWrfdxp31CkHeS1A.text: I went for lunch. Had a tasty strong Margarita on the rocks. Nice hostess, free biscuits, & WOW! Carolina Stuffed Baked Potato & Salad----DELICIOUS!!  It's a little expensive & takes some time to make, but WORTH the wait/$.

RjHnBAukgqQ7PFSeVL-5Qw.text: After a so-so experience at the Vegas location, I was asked by the owners to give them another shot.  The Vegas experience was tainted by service, not the quality or flavor of the food.  I thought it would be years before I was back in a town with a Lucille's, but just a couple months later, a trip to Phoenix gave me another opportunity.  I visited the Tempe Marketplace Lucille's.  The service was fantastic!  Kudos to the waitstaff.  They actually worked as a team, each helping the other when needed.  The food was good, but the baby backs I had tonight were not as good as the blacked fish I had in Vegas.  Guess I shoulda stuck with the fish.  However this restaurant has redeemed itself, and when I have the chance, I will be back.

pqGCxdDN-UAUaZST0HX61A.text: One word, food poisoning (read below)I want to give this place a good review but I just can't. Went today and received awful customer service, very slow. The private room we were in was freezing so we asked to turn it off and they server said he would do it ASAP, which he did, but it took 15 minutes to do so. Then as he finishes taking our order, he asks if we want biscuits and apple butter while we wait... Uhm hello apple butter, Yess please. About 20 minutes later 9 out of 11 meals come out, no biscuits yet. Then finally the biscuits come, so much for those coming out while we wait) and my food comes right after. We still had one person who had no food. I will say I was happy when the manager came and addressed the issue saying it should have come out with the rest of the food. She graciously took her meal off the check. Yes we had a larger group but none of us ordered complex food like ribs or pulled pork. Majority was chicken sandwiches.   My chicken sandwich was pink in the middle and I didn't notice until I got into the middle. Everyone was done eating so I just gave up. Now as I sit here at 4 am, I am wide awake due to being sicker than a dog all night.   I'm sorry for the one star but food poisoning is no joke. I will say that the apple butter lived up to its name.

xkOx1ag4lQSm4nHGFH27Sg.text: I ordered a meal and what I got was a feast! Yes you will spend over $40 per person here but it is oh so worth it. Just don't fill up on the delicious biscuits they put out as a starter!

CdM8DPH_dskbcbQPZeFjJw.text: This is one of the best BBQ places in Az. The food is very tasty. I had the beef brisquit and mac n cheese. The waitress was super nice and helpful. I will come her again soon. Thanks!!

QAxEJuXig5tjlSfAnSKS0w.text: Great BBQ! Love the baby back ribs and brisket. Excellent sides as well. Don't microwave your to go box though, it will melt and ruin any leftovers you may have. Very upsetting after dropping good money on good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t microwave your to go box
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t microwave your to go box

netPEMwYqaNQkTHBVmjY8g.text: Had the fried green tomatoes with rib tips! Melissa makes the best back porch strawberry lemonade... Epic!! Make sure to ask for Melissa, she is the best at custom making your drink and making suggestions!

f8fzRTf09ffs-TOUdT4kaQ.text: DO NOT order brisket. Only one word to describe it DRY, DRY and DRY!  We were very, very disappointed with our second visit. We will not be returning.

4Krnm_QybLE0LGsKSMmnWg.text: Possibly the best BBQ I have ever had. The free biscuits they bring out are amazing and  the pulled pork bbq sandwiches are beautiful. Interior was fun, great location, and the service was 10/10.

40C1sLVoU_pOConOHkFdSw.text: I found this place when we needed a place to meet for a business lunch.  I had the smoked BBQ chicken which was good but that seems to be all I get when I go.  I've tried some of the other dishes but haven't really liked them.  My wife loves the fried pickles which I'm not a fan of.  The portions are huge but there does not seem to be anything special I can remember besides really large portions.  I suppose the biscuits topped with sugar smothered in honey butter are good but I also want to live to be at least 50 and they are not worth dying for.  As unimpressed as I am with the food, the service is very good.  I've been there a few times now and have always been pleased with they way they treat us.  Everything from the speed and attentiveness has been good.

jchAhMY8dLyz0XL8y7PECQ.text: So. The food was worth more than two stars but man was the service horrible. We waited an hour and fifteen minutes for our food. It wasn't the servers fault, she was trying. The kitchen just responded that it's busy. Not coming back anyone soon

57-rMeCek72h-B2rUIdM4w.text: We went to Lucille's on Saturday night and had no problem getting a table on the patio. The menu is overwhelming because it's gigantic & everything looks absolutely delicious on it, so it's hard to choose. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw which was fabulous. Big, but not too big to have leftovers. My husband ordered a rack of ribs with mac & cheese and sweet potato fries. Everything was awesome & somehow still we had no leftovers.   The complimentary biscuits are worth trying Lucille's out in itself.   A must try!

2xBm7AgGCLpGFfMQJOzMPA.text: Lucille's always has great food. I have gone there over a dozen times and the service along with the food has always surpassed expectations. I would recommend the BBQ Shrimp or the BBQ Bacon and Cheeseburger. Along with their watermelon tea. I recommend this place all the time!

Qkf2cmVFiUcUIFpo0CL6DQ.text: My first visit to Lucille's was just OK. I didn't find anything special about the biscuits and butter spread. I ordered Fried chicken with garlic mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese. The chicken was fried hard and a bit too salty for me. The mashed potatoes were great and the macaroni and cheese was not good at all. No flavor and it was not baked like I'm used to having. The chicken was smothered in gravy which I didn't really enjoy. The highlight was the drink Cucumber Lemonade with Skyy Vodka and Cointreau. It was light and refreshing on a hot day. I can't promise I'll be back anytime soon but I'd be open to it only if someone else paid for it. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried chicken, garlic mashed potatoes and mac n cheese.
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cucumber Lemonade (contains alcohol)
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes

b96mNtm13qj2pQ3DssyeSQ.text: This place exceeded our expectations. I had baby back ribs and tri tip with the jalapeno cheese grits and peanut slaw. The slaw had an Asian taste to it, but surprisingly still went well with BBQ. My husband had the beef ribs and sausage with Mac and cheese and loaded mashed potatoes. His meal was also fantastic. His sausage was so rich with cheese flavor, and all the meats were fantastic, tender and smokey. We thought it was pretty pricey for BBQ, but we will definitely be back. Absolutely everything was delicious!

SPCKz2w5mrqTpdOufTXqmA.text: I'm really disappointed they wouldn't honor their normal happy hour times because it was a holiday. The guy working there seemed pretty unsure and had to check. This happened before and one person over wrote it. So it appears as if the staff is not on the same page, which is frustrating. I called several other happy hr establishments on same said holiday and they all still had it, so I feel justified in thinking that's really bizarre and uncommon. I would also note that the restaurant was DEAD and we had 4 people who would have all gotten multiple drinks and multiple orders of appetizers each, probably spending more than a single entree costs. It would have been in their best interest to keep the paying customers.

58fyOL5Vk51epKMsG_YdzA.text: The building for this restaurant sets a great ambience. The service is very attentive. The menu is abundant and priced on the high side of competitive. There are gluten free options as well. The food is delicious. The portions for the dinner plates are large - possibly enough to split. The experience was very enjoyable. I look forward to returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beef brisket with baked potato and sauteed veggies.

UrV7FkUmYQedWR7PpBN49A.text: Been wanting to try this place out for a few years. Finally went here Wednesday night.  Nice decor, music kinda to loud (we couldn't hear our companies conversation. Overly high prices. most things on the menu spicy and or deep fried. Wait time we were told was 15 minutes and we waited well over a half hour. Our waitress was very good  but was always making excuses for why service was very very slow.  Excuses included the following: The bisquits are coming out of the oven but someone else took our order. They ran out of mac n cheese. The cooks are extremely behind. Always an excuse for the slow service.  Food was poor quality and extremely over priced. Will not come here again. Once is enough!

m7YXCyjQwbPjkEw2n4ONVg.text: We decided to try here tonight to try something new! Glad we did! We sat in the bar area to avoid waiting. Service was fast and friendly! The portions were outrageous! Price was more than we usually like to spend but well worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Huge portions! Amazing service!

Lw3p58KOD-aJaUzWMDdvMw.text: Excellent! We're southerners (visited from Atlanta), and we were amazed at how authentic the food tasted. We're sad there isn't one anywhere near us. The ribs were amazing. Chicken tender and great. Mac n cheese Excellent! Definitely recommend.

BbXJYrWRR2JoQDV-mTzzqw.text: Cindy is the nicest sweetest waitress that I've ever had ever and she made this experience and the food above and beyond!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Last one of the night but this gumbo is so amazing!!!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Every time I get pulled pork here I&#39;m never disappointed and our waitress Cindy was so amazing I can&#39;t wait to come back

Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Words can&#39;t describe how amazing these nachos were and our waitress Cindy was so nice and energetic I can&#39;t wait to come back

WHYLeLm8nO-Pb0JZIiQz8Q.text: Couldn't wait to try the fried green tomatoes. What a pricey disappointment. For $10 you get five slices of tasteless, mushy inside-burned outside tomatoes. The breading is very thick and there is no green tomato taste at all. I ordered the Texas brisket sandwich - very good. Also got the peanut slaw. Hmmm. Very vinegary - couldn't finish it. My husband got the fried shrimp and catfish platter. Same thick, burned batter on the shrimp and fish. He said he could taste nothing at all but batter. Skinny little fries that are impossible to eat and turn into cold mush very quickly. Biscuits were good, but the place is way too expensive for the quality of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Overdone, thick batter on shrimp - cold, mushy potatoes

YQKuQZio7HhNYdgRUgvUJA.text: We were walking around Tempe marketplace and really didn't know where we wanted to eat until my wife started to smell the BBQ. So we decided on Lucille's. I've been here quite a few times but never wrote a review.   The place is decorated somewhat southern and very welcoming. We were surprised that we were seated right away and the server was right there to greet us. Nice.   We started off with the biscuits and apple butter. The apple butter is so good. I'm glad we didn't have that many biscuits cause we would have filled up on that. Anyways, I had the brisket with Mac & Cheese and corn on the cob. The brisket was really good with the extra BBQ sauce smothered on it. Tender and juicy. The Mac and cheese was very good and the corn on the cob was smothered in butter and was cooked just right. My wife had the fried catfish and shrimp. Very good. Catfish was very moist and crispy on the outside. Also, the shrimp was cooked just right. Just the right portions for my wife. So overall the food was very good. Enjoyed the food and company.   As for the service. Really good. Our server greeted us. Very friendly and kept on checking on us. She didn't have to fill up our water cause they bring you out these huge jars for your drinks. Also, the greeter were very friendly and smiling all the time. Very welcoming.   Overall I enjoy our time there. Good food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried catfish and shrimp with Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Brisket with Mac &amp; Cheese

YFMp5Y1riypz0uzDrUsdLQ.text: This was my first time here and first when i walked in I was not pleasantly greeted and was made to feel like my business was a burden, however once i got to my table everything took a 360. My server Stephanie was the best i've ever had and made me want to come back to Lucille's many more times! (request Stephanie i promise you won't be disappointed)

j8YaUpXRIdxKKZw4kDZQgg.text: Food is always great, I've never dined in but the take out staff is phenomenal! The food has tons of flavor, & its always served in good portions

43uQP1t9EgWfQ-PyUOHIxQ.text: For starters, I'm visiting the Phoenix area all the way from Kansas City, Missouri (the headquarters of all things barbecue), and this place totally rocks! I am impressed by the polite, caring staff as well as the super tasty food! Totally glad I stopped by here while on vacation, it was well worth it!   Highly recommended, especially, of course, if you're a fan of barbecue. 5 stars!  P.S. You're offered a warm, dampened towel once finished with the food to clean up. Just a nice little detail I thought I'd mention.

i8ra5YdUd7yRig8tFTDlnA.text: First time here and our waitress Jessica was the best... we will be returning... Meals were perfect and service was spot on!

v1ihWwMUydnKSciQB7-JXw.text: Lucille's has great meets. So far we have tried the pulled pork burger, the beef brisket and the rips. Everything was really tender and delicious, the rips fell right off the bone. The barbecue sauce that came with the ribs was close to perfection. I wish I could have tried all the sides, I picked the corn on the cob and potato salad. The corn was really good, the potato salad could have used some more flavor. The service was super friendly and attentive, we couldn't have asked for more. The gluten free menu clearly stated what's okay to order for me. Next time we might try the bar, it looked very inviting and cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States

bDsBEUed7NyiKL0h-OiWTw.text: I think the best way, for me, to describe Lucille's is "It's Pretty Good."  Let me preface, though. My mothers half of the family is super-country. I was raised by my grandma for my first 10 years of life, so I like to think I know how southern dishes are supposed to taste. They are literally from a town, in Kentucky, named Turkey Creek. How back woods is that? Therefore, my taste for Southern cooking is fine tuned, but I'm trying to loosen the reins a little bit while typing this review.  The restaurant is cute, the service is fine, and while the food is nothing to write home about, it's good. The hot towels at the end of our meal, were honestly the highlight for me. They were accommodating to our party of 20, and I don't think anyone had anything necessarily negative to say.   For me, it was just missing SOMETHING. The meat wasn't as tender or flavorful as I would anticipate from a self-proclaimed "smokehouse." The sauces were just alright. I'm comfortable with saying, they dropped the ball on their cornbread recipe. Those biscuits, though, they get a 10/10. I also thought everyone's flavored teas were pretty cute with the fruit floating in them.  Although it's a chain, I wish there were something that stood out to me to make me say, "We should go to Lucille's." - Nothing crazy bad. I've just had better BBQ, in the valley, and at a shyer price point.

3HrrJenqSqQGmKY-B7Cr9Q.text: Having  southern roots, of course I love BBQ. Just not this BBQ. Ugh. Dry brisket, dry coleslaw, dry biscuits and lardy cornbread.

_9MU9xLLYRQlZUvQGQESvg.text: Can't say enough about their server Lamont! We already love Lucille's - A+ on their food - but this is the best experience we have had! Lamont made our dinner so enjoyable with his friendliness and kept us laughing all evening!  Try the Smokehouse Margarita - it is truly smokin!

s_lMsldZyWy9RlEjjy9m2g.text: I like this restaurant.  I will come back whenever I have a chance.    The services/the servers are nice.  They are consistent with their skills.  Not once I got a bad service from them.  I love the Beef Ribs.  It is delicious.  I went to Bobby Q and Rustler's Rooster.  Lucille tastes a lot better.  Tons of parking.  Tons of shop to walk around after I pig myself out....hehehe

vFpXdKRrrbkF4LYePIjzOw.text: Fantastic smokehouse BBQ! Big portions, delicious meats, fresh baked bread, live music on the weekends - a fun place to spend with family and friends. Not to mention I'm a huge fan of any place that serves drinks in mason or ball jars.   Sit in the bar and watch the game or hang your hat and sit in the diner on the seriously comfortable booths. Buy some BBQ to take home on your way home.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. 1/2 rack St. Louis ribs with veggies and BBQ baked beans
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. 7 bone beef ribs dinner plate
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hot bread and honey butter and a side of sweet tea

JpN3izcJu4llIfFjLb8QkA.text: Stopped on for my 1st Hurricane drink for my birthday. Had a Mojito afterwords. The bartender Benjamin did an awesome job on making both drinks and really made me feel welcome. He mentioned the birthday cake and ice scream. We had that a waitress brought it out with a candle, lit tje candle and haned me a bday card with signatures od crew including Benjamin  Great place to celebrate your birthday

y6GmY7mfdhpp6FJ4hry86A.text: This is the second time I've been here and yet I was still so very pleased.   Came with some family members of mine to enjoy a celebration of an anniversary.   The appetizers were great, and of course the biscuits that come out are just to die for, and who could forget that yummy cinnamon tasting whipped butter.   I got something I have never gotten before. It was really a one off from what they usually serve but I said "what the heck, let's order it". It was good but I wouldn't order it again.   I kept picking at my brothers plate as he order something really, really good.   None the less, I'll be back.   Thank you, guys

3UMBNmZkJIjuAt35SFnGNw.text: Friendly service, good food &  yummy biscuits.   While this isn't the most amazing barbecue I've ever had, it was certainly a delicious plate of food! I had the brisket, ribs, potato salad and biscuits. Potato salad can be hit or miss for me, this one was a win for my pallet.   I appreciated the warm towels the service brought at the end of the meal. We cleaned our rib sticky hands and mouths. Such a nice touch! Much better than the disposable wet wipes.

47Hk9PjsU2DR2bB95ojGJQ.text: Lucille's had GIGANTIC portions for good prices. The smoked chicken was definitely my favorite part, with the biscuits and apple butter coming in a very close second. The chicken had great flavor and was ginormous! This was a real chicken and could've been a meal by itself. The rib tips and burnt ends were just ok, especially after being wowed by the first two items.   The staff was very attentive, and worked as a team to meet my group's needs. I think that they did a fantastic job.  I'll definitely swing back through the next time that I'm in the area, and my coworkers said the same thing! We all walked away stuffed, and satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bbq half chicken and two meats

4YkW5QdZKHSj_R1vz9NXvA.text: We arrived just before they closed and this didn't seem to bother them at all. We sat in the bar of their Flying Pig Lounge to enjoy some "reverse happy hour" specials, then we found out that happy hour goes all day every day and we could have sat anywhere :-) All good, the bar and lounge area turned out to be great! The atmosphere is really relaxed and open and fun. There is memorabilia everywhere, the seats are soft and comfortable, the tables are big, there are TVs to watch and the style is simply comfort, great music, barbecue and throwback.  Stephanie was our server and she could not have been nicer or more attentive. Same with the bartender, she was awesome also. Both were friendly and offered recommendations and were simply nice humans that took great care of us, they instantly felt like friends.  The food was excellent. We ordered off the happy hour menu and the food portions were enormous! The drink prices were great and the volume was also excellent. They bring you complementary homemade rolls with butter to start, that coupled with large portions and we were staffed by the end. We enjoyed the Lucille's onion straws, the Memphis pork loaded fries, and the barbecued rib tips. Yeah, it was a real health fest! All were delicious and honestly those three happy hour specials could have easily fed four people. The two of us were staffed and had to leave some of the onion straws behind. In priority order, the rib tips had to go first and the pork loaded fries second, you understand :-)  The value was excellent. We were out of there with plenty of food and a couple drinks for under $30 and the service, the atmosphere and the food were all very good.  I'd go back in a heartbeat and definitely recommend Lucille's Barbecue.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Memphis pork loaded fries, load me up!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rib tips, looking awesome!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Onion straws, yummy!

TLjmQUPCkI1Fy7AOK027jA.text: I've been to Lucille's before but never for happy hour. Well let me tell you I'm definitely doing this again. The happy hour menu is great. There are a ton of drying and appetizer choices. Most place I've been don't have this great of a menu. I got the fried pickles and the shredded pork sandwich. I'm a fried pickle snob so yes I just flavor and these were really good and done well. The sandwich was stacked high with pork. It was a tad dry but the Lucille's signature BBQ sauce was amazing in it. The bar area was really big and comfortable and the staff were really responsive to our needs. If you've never been here for HH, do give it a try. Oh lest I not forget that the prices were so great!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried pickles and shredded pork sandwich. Yum!!!
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Long Island iced tea and Jack and coke.

xlCfjpnhWoOxc3xAUdg-dg.text: Was here about one year ago. Food and service was good. I asked for a salmon salad. They don't have it on the menu as a salad but it is an entree choice on the menu. No-can-do... unfortunately there goes my attempt today for meal planning.  Second choice was burnt end BBQ tip salad with dressing on the side. Other guest had a burger and fries. Third person had brisket plate with a side. One iced tea. Sticker shock on the bill with tax about $66. No wonder they don't put prices on their online menu.  Two guests received their order. Server said they had to redo the salad because the kitchen did not put dressing on the side. Finally got the salad as others finishing their meal. The salad was very tasty and I took half home.   Guess Tempe Market Place is a high rent area and good BBQ is not cheap. Not my first choice for dining but good to know. I left a generous tip but probaby won't be back for another year.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burnt End Salad Full Portion

9N63HeuySqFLl03HDoCHCg.text: Always great service and great food! Awesome for happy hour or family dinner, even large gathering and work events! Lucille's is our favorite!

0QfLBUSoI78KmV5011OiXQ.text: We're driving through Greater Phoenix and are staying in nearby Tempe.  It was my  sister-in-law's birthday and she felt like BBQ.  Lucille's was our second choice and we also wanted to see Tempe Marketplace.   We got there at about 7:45 and it was packed! We had 30-40 mins to wait so we just left our name and phone number for them to txt when our table is ready.  It's a good thing I stayed behind while the rest of my party checked out the outdoor mall. The text for our table never came; I contacted my party when I heard them yell out our name.  Our waitress was friendly and talkative.  She had lots of suggestions for our drinks and meals.  I chose to go with her recommendation of an El Pepino margarita, a lime/cucumber tequila mix.  The bartender certainly didn't cheap out on the tequila and the drink was not too sweet and was very refreshing.  Our drinks and onion straw appy arrived right away.   For our meal, I chose the 7 oz BBQ tri tips with mac and cheese and the mixed veg.  It took almost 45 minutes for our meals to arrive and our waitress came by to apologize for the delay saying that the kitchen is getting killed.  Our waitress also very busy with plemty of tables and seem distracted; we had to ask multiple times for a straw and the 2x requested ketchup never came.  When we finally got our meal, I dug in to my sides: the creamy al dente mac and cheese with some cheddar melted on top, the sauteed mixed veg of string beans, carrots and onions were nicely seasoned. They were excellent sides.  Sadly, my BBQ tri tip was a bit tough and dry, and seem to be missing that smoke element.  The thin jus that came with it was not effective in adding to the flavour.  We were also brought biscuits with apple butter.  The biscuits were still warm but it had a sugar sprinkling on top which was reminiscent of a scone which I love eating for breakfast but moy for dinner.   I also got to taste the baby back ribs with the original BBQ sauce.  It seemed like the ends were burnt and were tough and not crispy.  I was hoping my sil's birthday meal would have been better.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Half order of onion straws with a spicy honey BBQ sauce
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. The Christmas Story leg lamp near the bar!

khy_YNxAdIjcdhX4JkbEZQ.text: BIG BEEEEEEEEEEEEEEF RIIIIBBBSSSSSSSS.   Had their beef ribs which were big, meaty hunks of tasty deliciousness.  Had the tasty onion straws too which were a good accompaniment to the BBQ ribs.   I also liked their Memphis bbq sauce which was kinda golden in color & tangy as well as their spicy bbq sauce.  I liked to mix them together.  Service was good, prompt and friendly too.  Overall, tasty bbq with good atmosphere and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States

Rsm7uhJTcPG-ondM1iSsUg.text: Service was awesome. Our server Anthony brought True southern hospitality. Recommended great dishes for us to order, super friendly, and polite. Ask for Anthony if you come here!

E54T4Dt_HwBSrNcgZMIK9Q.text: As you can see the sides were great but the streak was not. I asked for my streak to be medium rare and it came cooked through. Didn't expect a 8 oz streak to be so small and thin. It felt like I went to a Mexican restaurant and ordered the Carne Asada. It was really thin and after I asked the server if this Is how it should be, he replied with a rudely "yes" and walked away.  If you are looking for a good steak, don't order it here stick with the BQQ.  Maybe..... As I won't be coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t order the streak!

eIQ9B_srbopMl8j-awDgcA.text: Good Service!!  Thank You to Nathan...  I did have personal flavor issues with one of the sausages from the trio and the server was very kind and accommodating. In the end I couldn't resolve my issue and returned the dish.   Loved the Devil Eggs!!! And the Cheesecake was deliciously sweet and a large portion!  Will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lucille&#39;s BBQ Sauces

Zu-N4R9fKfGqc_2q5yAUbg.text: It's busy for Mothers Day. So you know what to expect. However I don't understand why management did not staff better than they did. These poor waiters/ waitresses have to run around and service multiple tables; with very big families and very big orders.  The wait is long (as expected) and our waitress is doing her best. On a normal day this place is spot on. This is just a "one off" because of the holiday. I just don't think management scheduled very well.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

iZnG_KTNdHyQMh1ymYJ9Jw.text: Two words. BEEF RIBS!!!!  There are only two BBQ places that smoke beef ribs. And the winner is Lucille's. They are meaty the right amount of char on the outside and when you bite into them it down right pops with flavor Gotta get them naked so you can apply your own sauce and this is a long run on sentence with bad punctuation and grammar but I don't care because I LOVE BEEF RIBs.  don't worry about the sides its so hard to screw up a baked potato, and corn. But it's even harder to find fabulous BEEF ribs.   Closing if you haven't had beef ribs and feel the True carnivore nature of human you need to. Throw your table manner out and be reckless in you devouring of meat the way it was meant to be. Messy, dirty and o so beautiful.  Go enjoy the BEEF ribs.

qZb3fFcOQWFaV_N7YMaY6g.text: Oh my goodnessssss! If you want to eat so good you will literally dream of the food, come to Lucille's! Now this restaurant is better suited when you come with a group of people as many of their menu items are sold in family size combos, and can be a bit pricey if it is only two people. However even then this place is a good splurge as the food is down right amazinggg! Their lemonades are delicious and unique and their bread is so fluffy and savory! If you're in the mood for some bb, go to Lucille's you won't regret it!

iWxry48kq3NtjymiWaf4oA.text: Went to dinner at Lucille's recently.  Knowing it can get crowded on a Sunday evening I went online to make reservations.  The website screwed up the time we wanted so I called to verify our reservations for 4 people at 6 pm.  The kid I spoke to was obviously confused because he booked us for 6 people at 4pm.  When we got there they didn't have our reservation but quickly got us seated anyway.  Kudos for good customer service. The food is very good, we ordered a selection of meats and enjoyed the different sauces.  The desert menu is small so we passed,  Not crazy about sitting right by the kitchen but the service was fast.  Not with 5 stars but certainly a strong 4 is in order.

rxXqYRJjrcqaraTB0GHynA.text: This pricey gem is was worth every penny!! I've been to hi-end restaurants with good food and excellent service or a hole in the wall restaurants with the best BBQ and good service, but Lucille's was the best of both worlds. Excellent food, service, atmosphere and facility ( wheel chair friendly )!!  I started with a drink called Gator Cooler with a water. Nice, and then main course Back Porch. My coworker had the Pull Pork Sandwich ( extremely juicy ). We both took home desserts ( Banana Pudding ).   They seem to have all kinds of seating from romantic, casual, group family or work, inside and outside seating.   I will be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Back porch
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crocodile cooler and water.
Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Parking for take out only.

XQsOZauGdu4Eq-OTlEcZjA.text: Great food and reasonable prices. Good for a large party. I have hosted 5 large dinners here. Everyone loves the food, service can be great or poor depending on your servers that night. They have a family feast that is enormous. Pulled pork and chicken are my favorite. Tried the gumbo today, not too shabby but I will stick to the meats going forward.

photos.caption: Photo of Lucille's Smokehouse Bar-B-Que - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gumbo

aMeGyCxhTqrkbc84l8d1nQ.text: Done Happy Hour Decent Amount of Of Choices Pulled Pork $9 Sandwich & Onion Thins Straws $4 Beer $2 @ Off  Now Week Day Happy Hour Is All Night Long M-Friday 3-Close  And Saturday & Sunday 9PM To Close !
